title: How to Raid Someone on Twitch: Send Viewers to Another Stream

steps.title: Type /raid “channel name” and press Enter or Return.
steps.content: Type /raid “channel name” and press Enter or Return . Replace "channel name" with the name of the channel you want to raid. This will start a raid on the channel. You can also click Raid Channel on your dashboard. This will show you a list of suggested channels to raid. [1] X Research source You won’t be able to raid someone if they’ve turned off receiving raids in their settings.

steps.title: Wait 10 seconds.
steps.content: Wait 10 seconds. You’ll see a small window pop up showing the number of viewers participating and a purple countdown bar. You can skip this step if everyone is ready to go before the 10 seconds are up.

steps.title: Click Raid Now.
steps.content: Click Raid Now . Or, wait for the countdown bar to end for the raid to start automatically. You’ve successfully raided a channel on Twitch! Click Cancel if you want to stop the raid from occurring. Raiding a channel will notify the channel’s viewers about who is raiding and how many people are part of the raid. Broadcasters and moderators can see recent raids in Settings > Tasks > Review Recent Raids . Raiding someone does not end your stream! Make sure to go back to your stream manager to do so when you’re done streaming.
